items.message: River levels are forecast to rise at the Whitewater Bridge river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible to begin between 04:00 and 06:00 tomorrow, 01/11/22. Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours. We expect river levels to remain high until 04:00 on 02/10/22. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Loughborough urban watercourses and local tributaries to the River Soar
items.message:

Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tonight, 31/10/2022 and tomorrow morning, 01/11/2022. Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high tomorrow morning, 01/11/2022.

Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses.

items.description: River Wiske and tributaries to the River Swale

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Wiske, Brompton Beck, Cod Beck, North Beck, Willow Beck, Sun Beck, Winton Beck

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise on the Brompton Beck, Cod Beck, River Wiske and Willow Beck due to rainfall expected overnight on Monday 31/10/2022. Flooding is possible at the River Wiske, Brompton Beck, Cod Beck, North Beck, Willow Beck, Sun Beck and Winton Beck on Monday evening 31/10/2022, and into Tuesday morning 01/11/2022. At Kirby Wiske, river levels are expected to rise later into Tuesday but are not expected to flood access roads at this time. Further rainfall over the coming days will mean river levels are likely to fluctuate.
We will continue to monitor levels closely and update this message by 09:00 on Tuesday 1/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

We will continue to monitor levels closely. This message will be updated by 09:00 on 1/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk include Land around the River Rye and it's tributaries, including Ralsdale Beck, River Seph, Ledge Beck, Fangdale Beck, Prodale Beck, Ladhill Beck, Etton Gill, Borough Beck and Spittle Beck, including properties of Salton, Nunnington and Helmsley. In these areas, flooding is expected overnight and into Tuesday morning the 1st of November. Further rainfall over the coming days will mean river levels are likely to fluctuate.
We will continue to monitor levels closely. This message will be updated by 09:00 on Tuesday 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels will rise on the River Mersey due to heavy rainfall overnight. Flooding is possible at low lying land and roads around Micker, Cringle, Sinderland and Poynton Brooks and their tributaries from early morning on 01/11/2022. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 01/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are expected to rise on the Middlesbrough Becks due to persistent rainfall overnight. River levels will be at their highest between 10:30 PM on Monday (30/10/2022) and 07:30 AM on Tuesday (01/11/2022). Flooding to low lying land, roads and footpaths is possible at locations near the Middlesbrough Becks. No property flooding is expected. Rainfall is forecast overnight and expected to ease by 9am. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels closely. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:00 AM on 01/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Wingfield Park river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible between 03:00 and 14:00 tomorrow, 01.11.22.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads along the River Amber around Ambergate.   
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until 04:00 on 02.11.22.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 09:00 on 01.11.22, or as the situation changes

River levels are forecast to rise at the Newnham Bridge river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible overnight tonight, 31/10/22.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the Ledyche Brook and River Rea. Locations that may be affected include Cleobury Mortimer, Neen Sollars and Caynham.   
We expect river levels to rise until early tomorrow morning, 01/11/22. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are liaising with emergency services.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated by 10:00 on 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Cheswick Green river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible this evening, 31/10/22 and overnight, 01/11/22.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Blythe between Cheswick Green and Blyth End. We are issuing this flood alert as a precautionary measure.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to rise overnight.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 01/11/22, or as the situation changes."

River levels are forecast to rise at the Little Alne river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible this evening and overnight 31/10/22. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Arrow between Studley and Salford Priors and the River Alne between Bird in Hand and Alcester on the River Alne including farmland and caravan parks. We are issuing this flood alert as a precautionary measure.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We expect river levels to rise overnight.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Sowe, River Sherbourne, Canley Brook and Finham Brook
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Kenilworth river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible overnight, 31/10/22 and tomorrow morning, 01/11/22.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to River Sowe between Bedworth and Baginton, River Sherboune between Allesley and Whitley, Canley Brook between Tile Hill and Canley and the Finham Brook at Kenilworth.   We are issuing this flood alert as a precautionary measure.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We expect river levels to rise overnight.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Shipston river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible overnight, 31/10/22 and tomorrow morning, 01/11/22. We are issuing this flood alert as a precautionary measure.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours, and consequently we expect river levels to rise overnight.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Eathorpe river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible overnight, 31/10/22 and tomorrow morning, 01/11/22.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Leam between Grandborough and Leamington including Kites Hardwick, Birdingbury, Marton, Eathorpe, Hunningham and Offchurch and the River Itchen between Southam and Marton including Long Itchington. We are issuing this flood alert as a precautionary measure.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. We expect river levels to rise overnight.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning 01/11/22, or as the situation changes.
